intro: Chionanthus kinabaluensis, commonly known as the Kinabalu chionanthus, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of Mount Kinabalu in Borneo. It is a member of the Oleaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while its bark is smooth and grayish in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
